channel.title: So many errors, so many problems
channel.description:
HALF SOLVED - See fourth post for more info!
[b]NO, this is NOT one of those same-old '"help me plx I have an errorzorz :eek:"' threads.[/b]
Ok, here's the story:
I've been working on this issue for at least three weeks, but just couldn't figure it out.
I got an error in the compile and runserver bats for all sources I tried. After two weeks of downloads, installs, uninstalls, path setting, etc, I FINALLY managed to get it right!
NOTE: I'm using Cheezscape here as an example.
When I run the Compile.bat, it shows many sections of text usually 3-5 lines long with pretty much the same stuff, like it's testing the things or something, and then it says "18 errors" at the bottom.
When I run the Runserver.bat, it QUICKLY flashes "exception in main..." and I can't even see the rest as it's so quick that the rest of the text is gone by the time it's displayed.
When I attempt to run the runMopar.bat, it says "exception in thread "main" java.lang...", and that's it. MoparScape won't work.
I can't get the online MoparScape Client to load either, it just says in the STATUS BAR "load: class AppletBot not found".
Please, HELP! I've downloaded and updated/installed/uninstalled/modified/moved/deleted over 80 different files/programs/etc trying to get this to work.
Sometimes one thing works, but makes the others worse. When I try to fix another it is slightly better but the first good one and the others are bad again.
Please, I desperately need help on this... :( :confused: :mad:

item.title: So many errors, so many problems
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

[quote=“madmax40, post:6, topic:15142”]seems like you don’t have the latest java , platform 2 does the job.[/quote]hmm or maybe he added a code in the wrong place that sometimes allows you to get multiple errors

Read full topic

seems like you don’t have the latest java , platform 2 does the job.

item.source: So many errors, so many problems

item.title: So many errors, so many problems
item.dc:creator: @Meepie Meepie
item.description:
@Meepie wrote:

Now, I’m NOT stupid enough not to understand this, but I still would appreciate more experienced help with this:

For both of them, it says “The system cannot find the path specified.”

So basically, I must download JRE/JDK 1.5.0_07 and install it in those paths, and it should work, right?

Also, links to the download pages for 1.5.07 would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: So many errors, so many problems

item.title: So many errors, so many problems
item.dc:creator: @monsha monsha
item.description:
@monsha wrote:

right click on compile.bat click edit, delete all thats in there and past this in there:
@echo off
title YOURSERVERNAME Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_07\bin/java.exe” server
pause

and in the runserver.bat delete whats in there and paste this in there:
@echo off
COLOR 08
title your server name Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin/java.exe” server
pause

in the ** ** put your server name that you want. and it should work it wont flash away fast and the compile should have no errors. hope it helps

Read full topic
item.source: So many errors, so many problems

item.title: So many errors, so many problems
item.dc:creator: @Meepie Meepie
item.description:
@Meepie wrote:

I know some java, and I’ve had many, many java experts try to help me out with this, but nothing good came out of it.

Besides, that’s not the response I’m looking for here.

Anybody else care to take a shot at this?

Read full topic
